motions.title: Table November 14, 2022 Meeting Minutes Approval
motions.description: Motion to table approval of November 14, 2022 City Council meeting minutes until December meeting.

motions.title: Consent Agenda Approval (Items 5-8)
motions.description: Approval of consent agenda items 5-8 including: • Capital Project Closeout and Reallocate Funding • Funding Authorization for 1240 Dunwoody Knoll Drive Storm Repairs • Funding Authorization for 5617 Woodsong Trail Storm Repairs • Funding Authorization for 2389 Welton Place Storm Repairs

motions.title: Text Amendment to Chapter 4 - Alcoholic Beverages (Second Read)
motions.description: Second read approval of text amendment to Chapter 4 Alcoholic Beverages to adjust alcohol licensing requirements.

motions.title: Funding Authorization for 124 Perimeter Center West Storm Repairs
motions.description: Approval of funding authorization for 124 Perimeter Center West (Phase 1) storm repairs as proactive maintenance in amount of $475,144.56 including 10% contingency.

motions.title: Motion to Enter Executive Session
motions.description: Motion to enter executive session for litigation and personnel discussion.

specialEvents.title: Officer and Employee of the Third Quarter Recognition
specialEvents.description: Chief Grogan introduced Officer Christopher Irwin and Public Service Representative Lyndora Anderson as Dunwoody Police Department's Officer and Employee of the Third Quarter.

presentations.title: Citizen Capital Committee Report
presentations.description: Report on Citizen Capital Committee scoring of transportation, parks, and paths/trails projects. Committee felt paths should be paused until PATH Foundation work completed, then reconvene in spring 2023.
presentations.presenter: Jay Vinicki and Council Member Lambert

discussionItems.title: Contract with Ogletree Enterprises for Landscaping
discussionItems.description: Presentation of contract with Ogletree Enterprises for landscaping on Chamblee Dunwoody/Spalding Drive intersection project. Ogletree submitted revised bid of $78,936 after clarifying missed items.

notes: Officer Jared Bradley oath postponed to next meeting due to illness
Committee recommended pausing paths until PATH Foundation completes work
